reviewText: This is an outstanding video that I use during my Vietnam/Counterculture of the 60s unit in class. The kids are riveted by it and it gives a lot of unknown information about the origins of some of my most famous memorials. The part on the Vietnam Wall Memorial in D.C. is extremely touching.
If your looking for info on the Washington DC memorials this is the movie to buy!!!!! It tells it all, nice price also!!!!!

Here gain the DVD which is very well done only gives info on Arlington Cemetary and the Vietnam war mmorial, it is very interesting and very well done but I has hoped ti have the other memorials: 2nd WW, Korean war ....
I just came back from my first visit of the USA. I`ve visited Washington DC and have seen the memorials. There were many infomations to get of this DVD.

I was in Washington, D.C. several years ago for a convention and had the opportunity to visit most of the war memorials.  The only one I missed was the Marine Corps one.  When you are at Arlington national Cemetary, you are walking on hallowed ground.  The ceremony of the changing of the guard by the Tomb of the Unknowns is very somber, awe-inspiring and moving.  As a nation, we owe a huge debt of gratitude that can never be repaid to these men and women who gave the ultimate sacrifice in the cause for freedom.
I've watched this video a few times and we always show it on our bus trips to Washington, DC when we take 50 VETERANS on a three day trip there each year from Southeastern Indiana.
EXCELLENT DVD I REALLY ENJOY IT. EXCELLENT HISTORY I HAVE SEEN SOME OF THESE PLACES AND I WANTED TO HAVE A DVD.
Received DVD in decent amount of time.  Item was as described.  Hope to deal with again.  Thanks for great service.
